The words 'The Internet' can refer to a variety of unique, interacting architecture, so it is important to distinguish which aspects of the internet are being discussed. This article seeks to formalize information regarding the energy use and related carbon emissions of three specific aspects of the internet: infrastructures for data storage and transmission, personal devices connecting to the internet, and cryptocurrencies. We determine these to be relevant in understanding a minimal environmental impact on the environment, how individuals contribute to it, and how societal obsessions contribute to it.
